item.description:
**NOTE** This trip has been bumped up to a longer journey due to the Sawyer River Road remaining closed. 730AM is a new start time and that is when we're to be at the Dunkin Donuts. From there, we'll drive to the trailhead.

Back by popular demand - a shot at climbing The Captain, a trailless NH 100 highest peak! The trip will be around 15 miles, climb about 2500' and take perhaps 10 hours.

The start and end of the hike is on a trail and a woods road (closed to traffic) but the middle portion will be a very exciting mix, which will hopefully include scrambling up a rockslide (if the ground is dry) and then at the top, we will be skirting alongside a cliff. This route is not technical, however.

If you have never bushwhacked before, this may not be the trip for you. I will take the uninitiated, but be forewarned this type of hiking is extremely taxing and you must be very hardy to have a chance of enjoying the excursion. If you are claustrophobic, or do not want scratches all over your body, do not sign up for this trip!

Important gear notes are as follows: you need to bring a working compass. Bring a map if you have one. If you do not have a map dont worry I will be bringing a photocopy for everyone, but bring a gallon size ziplock bag to keep the photocopy in, otherwise it will not last the trip.

Email me directly if you have any questions. If all of the survey questions are not answered you risk being removed from the trip, as space is limited.
item.name: Bushwhack to The Captain 3520' (NH100)
